title.description: The H1 title of the article, also the meta title.

image.description: This will be the above-the-fold image we lead with, and also the open graph image visible when sharing the post url.

intro.description: Try to keep this 155 characters. It'll also be used for meta descriptions and be the intro text introducing this article in article cards.

rightSide.description: Content placed on the right side within content container

rightSideFill.description: Content placed on right side that fills to the edge of viewport.

title.description:
This field holds the title of the web page, which appears in the browser tab and is used by search engines for the page's title in search results.

Essential for SEO assessments and verifying that the correct page title is displayed depending on the context or user interaction within the application. Also used in automated tests to confirm page navigation accuracy.

description.description:
It typically provides a brief summary of the page's content, used by search engines for page previews in search results.

Crucially used in SEO analysis to ensure the meta description is effectively optimized for target keywords and accurately reflects the page content. Also used in UI testing to verify if the meta description adheres to best practices regarding length and relevance.

nonIndexable.description: Used in SEO compliance checks and automated testing to ensure that pages meant to be private or under development are not indexed by search engines. It helps in managing the visibility of web pages on the internet.

layoutType.description: Use lead page to hide nav/footer items to push users to primary CTAs in the page content.

from.description:
The URL path to redirect from without following a slash.
e.g. /about

to.description: The URL to re-direct to, e.g. /foobar or https://example.org

mobileOrder.description: In which order does the content stack on mobile
